thread.title: Bulldog boys golf outshoots Mohave

title: Bulldog boys golf outshoots Mohave
text: Bulldog boys golf outshoots Mohave Lee Williams golfers first in Section VII Kingmanï¿½s Kim Carroll attempts to tip the ball over the Lee Williams defense of Madi Arave (10) and Mya Radler (3) Oct. 1 at KHS. (JC AMBERLYN/Miner) KINGMAN - The Bulldogs boys golf team beat out Mohave by 18 strokes Tuesday at Cerbat Cliffs Golf Course, 191-209."I'm very proud of the way my boys golfed," said Kingman High School boys golf coach Chad Baitinger. "They each had their personal best round of the season."Mohave's Chase Gurtler was the medalist, shooting 6-over-par 42.Derek Brown led Kingman with a 47 and was followed by Kurtis Toledo (48), Mathew Mendez (48) and Tanner Best (48). LWHS controls Section VII Lee Williams took down Section VII opponents Mingus, Coconino and Page Tuesday at Elephant Rocks Golf Course in Williams. The Volunteers shot 175, Mingus was second with 185, Coconino (188) came in third and Page (191) rounded out the team field.Lee Williams utilized a balanced attack led by Richard Serrano's 42. Corey Smith shot 43, Brandon Carver 44, and Cole Morton 46."Richard Serrano stepped up today," said LWHS boys golf coach Stephen Shuffler. "We're still looking to improve across the board as we head towards state."The Volunteers are in first place in Section VII. Section winners in the regular season get automatic bids for the state tournament Nov. 2-3.Lee Williams has an iWanamaker rating of 27.029, ahead of second-place Prescott's 30.317. VOLLEYBALL: Youngker sweeps Lady Vols A road trip into highly ranked territory came up empty for Lee Williams, as No. 19 Youngker (9-3 Division III, 1-1 Section II) swept the young Lady Volunteers 25-10, 25-14, 25-21 Tuesday in Buckeye.No. 42 Lee Williams (7-6, 1-1) hosts No. 33 Shadow Ridge (8-4, 1-1) in Section III action at 6 p.m. today. Havasu blanks Kingman Kingman continues to look for its first win of the season after the Lady Bulldogs were blanked by Lake Havasu (4-12, 1-2) in D-III, Section II play Tuesday in Lake Havasu City, 3-0.Kingman (0-11, 0-2) hosts No. 2 Parker (13-0, 3-0) in a section contest at 6 p.m. today.
